page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Lindsey and Kersey, part of which falls in our 'area' are historically famous for wool - Kersey and Lindsey Woolsey. There are superb weavers cottages within the area and the area is much visited. There is a Norman castle in Lindsey but it is really just earth works. I do not believe that any visible stonework remains. There is an Augustinian Priory Ruin within the area, but it is in private hands and access to it is not permitted. The previous chapel of the castle, St. James' Chapel is in the care of the Department of the Environment. It had many different uses before its recent recognition as an historical building.
